Based on your preferences, here are some recommendations:

- "The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers" (2002) directed by Peter Jackson - This epic fantasy film is based on J.R.R Tolkien's book series and follows the journey of Frodo Baggins and his companions as they try to destroy the One Ring that has caused much destruction in Middle-earth. This film stars Orlando Bloom, Billy Boyd, Christopher Lee and was directed by Peter Jackson.

- "Fantastic Mr. Fox" (2009) directed by Robert Zemeckis - This animated comedy film is based on the novel of the same name by Roald Dahl and follows the story of Mr. Fox who has been stealing gold from a nearby mine for several years now. However, one day while trying to steal some more gold from the mine, Mr. Fox gets caught in a trap set up by one of his former partners named Boggins. As a result of getting caught in the trap set up by Boggins, Mr. Fox ends up spending a lot of time in a small and isolated room called "the cave" that is located deep underground inside a mine complex owned and operated by Boggins. As a result of spending a lot of time in the cave, Mr. Fox ends up developing a very strong and durable sense of smell and olfactory memories that he can use to help him navigate and survive in various different environments and situations.
